dance 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

ballet

ballet.Rd

ballet() iterates on the groups, as identified by dplyr::group_rows()), and applies the choreography() to each group.

ballet(.tbl, ..., .env = caller_env())

Arguments

.tbl

A data frame
...

Description of the columns to create, see choreography() for details.
.env

parent environment of the function generated by choreography()

Value

a list of 2 elements

  • ptypes : a list of n_moves types, in the sense of the .ptype argument to vctrs::vec_c()

  • steps : a list of n_groups results, each of size n_moves

Details

The grouping structure of .tbl defines the number of groups n_groups and the formulas in ... gives the number of dance moves n_moves

Examples

data <- iris %>%
  group_by(Species)

# most dance functions get the result of ballet()
# and then process it
c(ptypes, steps) %<-%
  ballet(data,
    Sepal.Length = ~mean(Sepal.Length),
    Sepal.Width  = ~mean(Sepal.Width)
  )
ptypes
#> $Sepal.Length
#> NULL
#> 
#> $Sepal.Width
#> NULL
#> 
steps
#> [[1]]
#> [[1]]$Sepal.Length
#> [1] 5.006
#> 
#> [[1]]$Sepal.Width
#> [1] 3.428
#> 
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [[2]]$Sepal.Length
#> [1] 5.936
#> 
#> [[2]]$Sepal.Width
#> [1] 2.77
#> 
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [[3]]$Sepal.Length
#> [1] 6.588
#> 
#> [[3]]$Sepal.Width
#> [1] 2.974
#> 
#> 

purrr::transpose(steps)
#> $Sepal.Length
#> $Sepal.Length[[1]]
#> [1] 5.006
#> 
#> $Sepal.Length[[2]]
#> [1] 5.936
#> 
#> $Sepal.Length[[3]]
#> [1] 6.588
#> 
#> 
#> $Sepal.Width
#> $Sepal.Width[[1]]
#> [1] 3.428
#> 
#> $Sepal.Width[[2]]
#> [1] 2.77
#> 
#> $Sepal.Width[[3]]
#> [1] 2.974
#> 
#> 
purrr::map_dbl(steps, 1)
#> [1] 5.006 5.936 6.588
purrr::map_dbl(steps, 2)
#> [1] 3.428 2.770 2.974
